item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: The Podquisition "Special" One-Man Turkey-Boy Episode
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
A regular Podquisition has been recorded but I'm waiting to be able to post it. Until then, I didn't want you to go without any delicious audio, so I recorded a mistake for you to enjoy!
Your ol' pal Jim Sterling tried to record Podquisition. Alone. It went as well as you expect.
I want to say it really picks up in the final act when Justin arrives and the Turkey Boy is born, but I really don't know.
item.itunes:subtitle: A regular Podquisition has been recorded but I'm …
item.description:
A regular Podquisition has been recorded but I'm waiting to be able to post it. Until then, I didn't want you to go without any delicious audio, so I recorded a mistake for you to enjoy!
Your ol' pal Jim Sterling tried to record Podquisition. Alone. It went as well as you expect.
I want to say it really picks up in the final act when Justin arrives and the Turkey Boy is born, but I really don't know.

item.title: The Spin-off Doctors: Wing Commander
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
Oh hello there, it's time to have a bad time. We call this time the Bad Time Time.
Wing Commander is not a very good movie, but we watched it anyway. A 1999 movie that looks like it was made in the 1980s, featuring a plot that makes no sense, a lack of antagonists, and the worst space navy in the universe, it's one of those films that might have been entertainingly bad if it wasn't just plain bad.
Anyway, your Movie Boys try and make it interesting for you.

item.title: Special: Jim Sterling And Digital Homicide Hash It Out
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
The immovable force meets the store-bought object, as Jim Sterling and Digital Homicide face off. The studio, having finally had enough of my antics, demanded an interview and yelled at me about my cowardice. My audience demanded I rise to the occasion, and rise I did.
Listen as Digital Homicide talks over me, attempts to use mad scientist tropes to prove I'm a bad person, tries to invent a conspiracy theory about me, and claims there's no difference between The Jimquisition and The Slaughtering Grounds.
Well... it's something to listen to, I suppose.

item.title: Podquisition Episode 30: E3 2015
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:

We also discuss Mortal Kombat X's shameful DLC, free-to-play psychology, Laura's latest sex game, and Jim Sterling's ownage of Blighttown. Oh, and stick around for the ending, as we have an exclusive clip of Gavin's upcoming song based on Bloodborne!
Forgive the audio quality this week. It's not terrible, but we had to make it a single call due to bringing in Lorne, so connections were a bit spotty.

On this week's show, one of us is getting married! Well, conditionally... the proposal isn't out of Early Access yet.
We chat a bit more about Peter Molyneux and "that" interview. We discuss the New 3DS and Nintendo's classically Nintendo moves. We also chat a bit about The Order: 1886, because OH BOY is that a fun topic!

item.title: Podquisition Episode 12: The Buckfast Problem
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's episode, we get a few rounds of attacking Ubisoft in before Gav shows up, and Laura tortures herself with the vicious taste of Buckfast. We also discuss The Many Lies of Peter Molyneux, and chat more about Evolve, because of course we do.
Elsewhere, there's excitement for Bethesda's E3 conference, and we discuss all the ways in which Netflix could make its Legend of Zelda TV series absolutely awful!

item.title: Podquisition Episode 11: BDSM And King Henry VIII Tits
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's butt-packed episode, the crew talk about how boobs were better in historical times, the ethics of BDSM, and the magical powers that give LGBTQ people an alleged advantage in e-sports.
We also talk about Darkest Dungeon, Life Is Strange, Dying Light, and Ubisoft doing something not-terrible for once. Yay!

item.title: Podquisition Episode 10: Falling In A River On Drugs
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's show, the team discusses falling into rivers, driving through nettles, and wallowing about in Wales, all while Laura desperately tries to simulate all the Euro trucks.
Also, we discuss Dying Light, Resident Evil's oft-maligned controls, and the time police dogs in Amsterdam thought an infected foot was a bunch of drugs.

item.title: Podquisition Episode 8: The Numbers
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
This week, the gang talks about review scores and why they're okay sometimes. Maybe. A bit. Most people hate The Numbers, and they hate Metacritic too, but The Jimquisition uses them because of Some Reasons.
There's also some videogame talk, including discussion of a game that has zombies and big breasts in it. So... that's good.

item.title: Podquisition Episode 7: It's Not Semen
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
This week, your ol' pal Jim manages to get superglue (and it IS glue) all over his hands. It's very distressing and frightening for him.
Elsewhere, we talk about weird games that involve fighting terrorists as teenage girls, beating horses to death, and fapping in thirty seconds. Also, Ubisoft did something stupid again. Because Ubisoft.

item.title: Podquisition Episode 6: Fish Sex
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
We ring in the new year by talking about banging a goldfish, filling Mega Man's enemies with bodily fluids, and Play-Doh's veiny mistake. So, traditional New Year topics!
We also chat a lot about the games we're looking forward to in 2015. Because really, who needs to stop hearing about Bloodborne?

item.title: Podquisition Episode 2: Drink Call of Duty Responsibly
item.itunes:author: Jimquisition
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's episode, there's corruption on the high seas as soft drinks and snack products worm their way into our filthy, clogged hearts. We have a go at Ubisoft some more, make fun of Haunted House, and there's yet more Dragon Age love sneaking in.
We also have a right ol' moan about microtransactions and branded pizzas. And pisspots.
